channel.title: üè¢ Singapore Management University on NeurIPS 2024
channel.description: Recent content in üè¢ Singapore Management University on NeurIPS 2024

item.title: Improving Environment Novelty Quantification for Effective Unsupervised Environment Design
item.description: Boosting AI generalization: CENIE framework quantifies environment novelty via state-action coverage, enhancing unsupervised environment design for robust generalization.

item.title: Inverse Factorized Soft Q-Learning for Cooperative Multi-agent Imitation Learning
item.description: New multi-agent imitation learning algorithm (MIFQ) leverages inverse soft Q-learning and factorization for stable, efficient training, achieving state-of-the-art results on challenging benchmarks.

item.title: Learning De-Biased Representations for Remote-Sensing Imagery
item.description: DebLoRA: A novel unsupervised learning approach debiases LoRA for remote sensing imagery, boosting minor class performance without sacrificing major class accuracy.

item.title: Mimicking To Dominate: Imitation Learning Strategies for Success in Multiagent Games
item.description: IMAX-PPO: A novel multi-agent RL algorithm leveraging imitation learning to predict opponent actions, achieving superior performance in complex games.

item.title: Safety through feedback in Constrained RL
item.description: Reinforcement Learning from Safety Feedback (RLSF) efficiently infers cost functions from trajectory-level feedback, enabling safe policy learning in complex environments.

item.title: SampDetox: Black-box Backdoor Defense via Perturbation-based Sample Detoxification
item.description: SampDetox uses diffusion models to purify poisoned machine learning samples by strategically adding noise to eliminate backdoors without compromising data integrity.

item.title: SPRINQL: Sub-optimal Demonstrations driven Offline Imitation Learning
item.description: SPRINQL: Sub-optimal Demonstrations for Offline Imitation Learning
